name: Famous Jessicas Quiz | Birth and Stage Name | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following famous Jessicas starred as Janey Glenn in the 1985 teen dance comedy "Girls Just Want to Have Fun"?
questions.explanation:
Sarah Jessica Parker.

	Sarah Jessica Parker was born on March 25, 1965. She married Matthew Broderick on May 19, 1997 and their first child was a boy, James Wilkie Broderick.  She is best known for her work as Carrie Bradshaw on the popular HBO series "Sex and the City".

questions.text: Which Jessica portrayed Nicole Brown Simpson in the 1995 television movie "The OJ Simpson Story"?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Tuck.

	Jessica Tuck is best known for her work on the soap opera "One Life to Live" as Megan Gordon Harrison.

questions.text: Which of these actresses was the oldest Jessica to win an Oscar?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Tandy.

	Jessica Tandy was born in London, England June 7, 1909.  She won her Oscar for her portrayal of an old Southern woman who befriends her black driver in the 1989 drama "Driving Miss Daisy".  Other works that Jessica can be seen in include "Fried Green Tomatoes" (1991); "Cocoon" (1985); and "September Affair" (1950).  She was diagnosed with ovarian cancer in 1990 and died from the disease in 1994.

questions.text: How many Oscars did Jessica Lange win in the 1980s and 1990s?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Jessica Lange won the 1983 Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her work as a soap opera star in the 1982 comedy "Tootsie" (1982).  She won a Best Actress Oscar for her work in the 1994 drama "Blue Sky".  She was nominated for six acting Oscars during those 2 decades, the other 4 being "Frances" (1982), "Country" (1984), "Sweet Dreams" (1985), and "Music Box" (1989). All of those 4 nominations were for Best Actress in a Leading Role.

questions.text: Which Jessica starred in the critically acclaimed 1991 television drama "Homefront"?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Steen.

	Jessica Steen starred as Linda Metcalf in the television series that dealt with the lives of several small townsfolk following World War II.  Other works that Jessica can be seen in include "Sing" (1989) and "Armageddon" (1998).

questions.text: Of these four ladies, which Jessica was a successful journalist/broadcaster?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Savitch.

	Jessica Savitch was born in Pennsylvania on February 1, 1947.  She was the first woman in the South to anchor a broadcast.  In October of 1983 she and her boyfriend, Martin Fischbein, was involved in a fatal road accident.  Also killed in the accident was her beloved Siberian husky, Chewy.  Her estate was awarded $8 million for wrongful death.  The majority of the money was used to fund college scholarships.

questions.text: Which Jessica stars in her own reality series called "Newlyweds:  Nick and Jessica".
questions.explanation:
Jessica Simpson & Simpson.

	Jessica Simpson and Nick Lachey star in the reality series that follows their lives as a newly married couple.  Jessica was born July 10, 1980 in Waco, Texas.

questions.text: Which Jessica starred as Erin in the 2003 remake of the 1974 horror classic "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre"?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Biel.

	Jessica can be seen on the drama "7th Heaven", in which she played Mary Camden from 1996-2003.  Other works that Jessica Biel can be seen in include "I'll Be Home for Christmas" (1998); "Summer Catch" (2001); and "The Rules of Attraction" (2002).

questions.text: Which Jessica starred in the films "Play Misty for Me" (1971) and "The Flamingo Kid" (1984)?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Walter.

	In "Play Misty for Me" Jessica stars as a woman who becomes obsessed with a DJ after a brief affair.  In "The Flamingo Kid" she stars opposite Matt Dillon and Richard Crenna in this coming of age story set around a popular beach club.

questions.text: Which Jessica starred as Max Guevera in the 2000 drama "Dark Angel"?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Alba.

	Jessica Alba was born April 28, 1981, in Pomona, California.  "Dark Angel" only lasted for two seasons on FOX.
